Description: Lid sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; cream slip; interior reserved; exterior: two black-figure friezes separated by dot frieze between dilute lines; upper frieze has part of lion to right (belly with added red, tail and hind legs remaining); incised rising and pendant rosettes with red centres as filling ornament; lower frieze preserves part of sphinx to left (part of curlicue and wing remaining).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Royal Museum of Art and History, Brussels. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Brussels III / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Belgique (p. 2, pl. 3, no. 5)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 316, no. 1359, pl. 175)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2100) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire, Brussels
Acquisition notes: Donated to the museum by the Egypt Exploration Fund
